clinical_study.brief_title: Sevoflurane and Propofol on POD and POCD
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Anesthetics Sevoflurane and Propofol on Postoperative Delirium (POD) and Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction (POCD)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will perform clinical studies to test the hypothesis that participants who have total hip/knee replacement under propofol anesthesia will have less POCD/POD as compared to participants who have the surgery under sevoflurane anesthesia, and POCD/POD is associated with retinal nerve fiber layer (RNFL) thickness, as well as Serum level of vitamin B12, folic acid, homocysteine and human myeloid differentiation protein-2 (MD-2s). The investigators plan to perform the studies in 200 participants in Shanghai 10th People's Hospital.

arm_group.description: Patients in Sevoflurane group are maintained with sevoflurane (1%~4% inhalation), remifentanil (0.1~0.3μg•kg-1•min-1, intravenous administration) and cisatracurium (0.1mg•kg-1•h-1 intravenous administration).

Patients in propofol group are maintained with propofol (1-3μg/ml plasma target controlled infusion), remifentanil (0.1~0.3μg•kg-1•min-1, intravenous administration), and cisatracurium (0.1mg•kg-1•h-1 intravenous administration).

intervention.description: Anesthesia maintenance with sevoflurane+remifentanil guided by Narcrotrend index monitoring.
Anesthesia maintenance with propofol+remifentanil guided by Narcotrend index monitoring.

biospec_descr.textblock: The investigators will collect 10ml venous blood before anesthesia, and then 10ml venous blood after surgery on Day 1, Day 4 and Day 7, respectively. Serum level of vitamin B12, folic acid, homocysteine and myeloid differentiation protein-2 (MD-2s) will be tested.

study_pop.textblock: Patients,who had knee or hip fractures and admitted to the Department of Orthopedics in Shanghai 10th People's Hospital, were screened and asked to participate in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) class I-Ⅲ
- Aged from 60 years to 85 years
- Hip/knee surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Alcoholism or drug dependence
- Severe psychiatric and neurological diseases
- Visual or auditory defects
- Inability to understand the language (Mandarin Chinese) used
- Participating in the investigation of another study
